intro: Hemionitis elongata, commonly known as the slender hemionitis, is a small evergreen herbaceous plant native to the mountainous regions of central and southern China. It belongs to the family Hemionitidaceae and is characterized by its compact, mat-forming growth habit. The plant features narrow, linear leaves that are often covered in a dense layer of fine hairs, giving it a fuzzy appearance. It produces small, inconspicuous flowers that are typically greenish-white in color. Hemionitis elongata is adapted to rocky and well-drained soils, often growing in shaded, moist environments.
